refsect1.title: DESCRIPTION
refsect1.para: This program performs various tests of the pointing model. It can be used to compare corrections predicted by pointing model with these measured by astrometry, either by using model.dat file (TP input file), or from raw fits images. The former should be considered as the main functionality, most options are applicable only for this case, without additional notice. Operation on raw images is rather informative, it uses simple logic, without exact computations (still working good in most cases).

refentry.refsect1:
OPTIONS
&optiongnu;
&basicapplist;
-m
Specify tpoint model file to use.
-e
Print errors of measured vs predicted. Use two e to print also errors in RA and DEC. All output values are in arcminutes.
-R
Include atmospheric refraction into corrections.
-a
Print also alt-az coordinates together with errors.
-j
Print also computed JD together with errors. JD is computed using longitude, obtained from local rts2.ini file. It could be wrong for some cases (e.g. while testing model on non-original system), but it should not influence the results. Still, it could be usable for comparing the acquire time of the images.
-N
Print numbers, do not pretty print.
-v
Report model progress.
-i
Print model for given images. Alternative program operations - from images on imput get difference between intended and real (astrometry-measured) position, and compare this with our model results. It uses only trivial computations (no real transformations, only differences, assuming the precession, refraction etc is invariant within used limits), which could be inaccurate in some cases. The columns are described in the output, the last column in output should be close to zero if the model is good.
-r
Print random RA DEC, handy for telescope pointing tests.
